s0001: Lord Shang was a bastard son of a branch of the Wei nobility, named Yang, surnamed Gongsun, his ancestry originally of the Ji surname.
s0002: Yang in youth delighted in the study of law and names, served as junior aide to Wei chancellor Gongshu Zuo.
s0003: Gongshu Zuo knew his worth, but had not yet advanced him.
s0004: Just then Zuo fell ill, King Hui of Wei personally went to inquire after his illness, said: 'If chancellor should die, what shall we do for the state?'
s0005: Gongshu said: 'My junior aide Gongsun Yang, though young, has extraordinary talent, I wish Your Majesty would entrust the entire state to him.'
s0007: The king was about to leave when Zuo dismissed his attendants and said: 'If Your Majesty does not employ Yang, you must kill him, do not let him leave the borders.'
s0009: Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized: 'Just now when the king asked who could be chancellor, I recommended you, but the king's expression did not approve.
s0010: I am putting the ruler first and ministers second, so I told the king that if he does not employ Yang, he should kill him.

s0013: Yang said: 'If he cannot employ you by following your recommendation to use me, how can he employ you by following your recommendation to kill me?'
